meta.title: Implementation Protocols for Regenerative Governance - Global Governance Frameworks
meta.description: Detailed protocols and step-by-step guides for implementing regenerative governance frameworks across diverse contexts.

hero.title: Implementation Protocols
hero.subtitle: Step-by-step guides for systemic transformation
hero.description: Comprehensive protocols that bridge theory and practice, providing clear pathways for implementing regenerative governance in real-world contexts.

culturalTranslation.title: Cultural Translation Protocol
culturalTranslation.subtitle: Adapting governance frameworks across cultural contexts
culturalTranslation.description: A comprehensive three-phase protocol for respectfully adapting governance frameworks across diverse cultural contexts while maintaining cultural integrity and avoiding appropriation.

phases.name: Foundation Phase
phases.description: Deep dialogue, sovereignty agreements, and relationship building

phases.name: Implementation Phase
phases.description: Co-design, pilot testing, and iterative refinement

culturalTranslation.useCase: Essential for: Indigenous partnerships, international implementations, multicultural communities, and any cross-cultural governance work.

fpic2.title: FPIC 2.0 Protocol
fpic2.subtitle: Enhanced Free, Prior, and Informed Consent
fpic2.description: An evolved approach to FPIC that addresses power imbalances, ensures meaningful participation, and protects Indigenous rights in governance decisions.

phases.name: Relationship Establishment
phases.description: Building trust and authentic relationships before any formal processes

phases.name: Information Sharing
phases.description: Culturally appropriate information exchange and capacity building

phases.name: Deliberation Period
phases.description: Internal community decision-making using traditional processes

phases.name: Consent Documentation
phases.description: Formal documentation with ongoing consent mechanisms

fpic2.useCase: Required for: Any governance process affecting Indigenous peoples, traditional knowledge, or ancestral territories.

consensusBuilding.title: Regenerative Consensus Protocol
consensusBuilding.subtitle: Building agreement across difference
consensusBuilding.description: A systematic approach to reaching meaningful consensus that honors diverse perspectives and creates resilient collective decisions.

phases.name: Preparation Phase
phases.description: Stakeholder mapping, process design, and relationship preparation

phases.name: Exploration Phase
phases.description: Deep listening, perspective sharing, and common ground identification

phases.name: Co-Creation Phase
phases.description: Collaborative solution development and iterative refinement

phases.name: Integration Phase
phases.description: Final agreement, implementation planning, and accountability structures

consensusBuilding.useCase: Effective for: Multi-stakeholder initiatives, organizational governance, community planning, and policy development.

powerAnalysis.title: Power Dynamics Assessment Protocol
powerAnalysis.subtitle: Understanding and addressing power imbalances
powerAnalysis.description: A comprehensive framework for analyzing power dynamics in governance processes and implementing strategies to create more equitable participation.

phases.name: Power Mapping
phases.description: Identify power sources, holders, and dynamics in the system

phases.name: Impact Analysis
phases.description: Assess how power imbalances affect participation and outcomes

phases.name: Strategy Development
phases.description: Design interventions to address identified imbalances

phases.name: Implementation & Monitoring
phases.description: Implement strategies and continuously monitor power dynamics

powerAnalysis.useCase: Critical for: Multi-stakeholder processes, community development, organizational change, and policy reform initiatives.

getInvolved.title: Co-Develop These Protocols
getInvolved.description: These protocols are refined through real-world implementation and community feedback. Join pilot programs or contribute based on your experience.

implementation.title: Implementation Support
implementation.description: Implementing these protocols requires skill, patience, and community support. We provide:

support.description: Skill-building workshops for facilitators and practitioners
Connect with others implementing similar protocols
Templates, case studies, and adaptation guides

principles.title: Core Implementation Principles
principles.description: All protocols are guided by these foundational principles:

list.name: Cultural Sovereignty
list.description: Every community maintains the right to govern according to their own values and ways of knowing

list.name: Regenerative Impact
list.description: Protocols should strengthen rather than extract from communities and ecosystems

list.name: Power Equity
list.description: Address power imbalances and ensure meaningful participation for all stakeholders

list.name: Adaptive Learning
list.description: Protocols evolve through implementation experience and community feedback
